justification: Minimal ToM: it doesn’t address B’s upside bias, dual-threat QB/stack preference, or buy-low injury stance. Perspective-taking is shallow (only notes B ‘upgrades RB’). Consistency issues: calling Tyler Anderson a stabilizing TE for conservative A despite being doubtful is dubious; ‘RB depth maintained’ for A is inaccurate after losing a Tier 1 workhorse. Trade is somewhat feasible (B gets RB help, has other TEs) but the value and rationale are thin and not grounded in the profiles.
